intro: Trientalis borealis var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender starflower, is a perennial herb native to northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and distinctive star-shaped white flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, acidic soils in boreal and subarctic environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It plays an important ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
